title: Justin Trudeau Rightly Points Out That Internet Porn Licenses Are A Dumb Fucking Idea; But He Still Supports Internet Censorship Bill
description: With the UK moving forward with its plans for an online “porn license” for anyone to view adult content online, and with various state legislatures pushing to effectively require the same in the US, this dumb and counterproductive idea is proving quite popular among the political class. Thankfully, not in Canada. Canadian Prime Minister Justin […]

title: Ken Paxton Sues Pornhub’s Parent Company Aylo For Alleged Violations Of Texas Anti-Porn Law
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has sued Aylo, the parent company of Pornhub and some of the most popular adult film studios and premium porn websites. Based in Montreal, Quebec, Aylo (formerly MindGeek) maintains a global media empire of adult sites. Paxton makes clear in a press release that the lawsuit aims to enforce a […]

title: Alito Wants To Weigh YouTube, And The Rest Of SCOTUS Wants To Make An Easy Case Hard
description: As Mike already noted, the weirdest moment of the nearly four-hour, double-case hearing at the Supreme Court on Monday in the NetChoice and CCIA legal challenges of Florida’s and Texas’s social media laws came maybe two thirds into the oral argument, when Justice Alito openly wondered, “If YouTube were a newspaper, how much would it […]

title: Daily Deal: The Lean Six Sigma Career Advancement Bundle
description: Lean Six Sigma is one of the most popular business strategies for reducing waste, accelerating product delivery, and ultimately driving profit. With 4 courses, this bundle will help you learn lean project management principles and implement them with your organization’s overall business process. This will contribute to making data-driven decisions, saving more time, and improving […]

title: FTC Reveals That Twitter’s Old Security Team Prevented Elon From Violating FTC Consent Decree With Twitter Files Access
description: Soon after Elon took over Twitter and brought with him a sink-shaped wrecking ball, we wrote a story wondering if there was anyone left at the company who remembered that the company had a consent decree with the FTC that required it to take certain steps to make sure private info was not revealed to […]

title: The Guy Behind That Biden AI Deepfake Robocall Is Going To Go Through Some Things
description: Last month you probably saw the story about how somebody used a (sloppy) deepfake of Joe Biden in a bid to try and trick voters into staying home during the Presidential Primary. It wasn’t particularly well done; nor was it clear it reached all that many people or had much of an actual impact. But it clearly […]

title: As Predicted: Scammers Are Now Scanning Faces To Defeat Biometric Security Measures
description: For quite some time now we’ve been pointing out the many harms of age verification technologies, and how they’re a disaster for privacy. In particular, we’ve noted that if you have someone collecting biometric information on people, that data itself becomes a massive risk since it will be targeted. And, remember, a year and a […]
